info.title: net2phone webhooks
info.description:
Introduction

The net2phone webhooks give you the ability to receive a structured payload of data at the URL of your choice when certain events occur. For example, you can use the webhooks to notify your CRM application that a call has been completed or notify your messaging application that a call has been parked or unparked

Getting started

Log into https://app.net2phone.com and go to Settings / API, click on the ‘Webhook’ tab, and click on ‘Add Webhook’, follow the on screen directions to set up the webhook.

call_answered.title: Call answered
call_answered.description: This event is triggered when a Team Member answers an incoming call or when an outgoing call is answered by the dialed destination number

event.description: Describes the event that triggered the webhook notification

timestamp.description: Date and timestamp of the trigger event. Date and time are in ISO8601 UTC format

direction.description: Can be either inbound or outbound. Inbound describes an incoming call answered by any Team Member. Outbound describes an outgoing call made by any Team Member

originating_number.description: Describes the number that started the phone call

dialed_number.description: The recipient of the phone call

call_leg_id.description:
Describes a unique identifier for the leg of a call that has multiple legs.
For example, if a single call is answered, put on hold, and then transferred via consultative transfer to another Team Member, each leg of the call will have a unique call_leg_id, but  a common call_id

call_id.description: Describes a unique identifier for call

call_source.description: Can be either Normal or click2call. Normal describes a standard call via phone or web dialer, click2call describes a call initiated via the net2phone Click2Call API

user.description: The user object describes information about the user and account that triggered the event

id.description: A unqiue identifier assigned to each Team Member

name.description: The full display name of the Team member

account_id.description: This is your net2phone account ID

user_name.description: Is provided for backwards compatibility with previous versions of webhooks only. It’s strongly suggested that you avoid using this field.

click_to_call_info.description: Information about the click to call event. Present only when the `call_source = click2call`

c2c_api_request_id.description: Unique ID of the click2call api request

call_blind_transfer.title: Call blind transfer
call_blind_transfer.description: This event is issued when a Team Member transfers a call via  blind (cold) transfer

call_blocked.title: Call blocked
call_blocked.description:
This event is triggered when an incoming call is blocked.
If the number is blocked at the account level only the `user.account_id` field is present - see examples.

call_busy.description: The event is triggered when an outbound call receives a 4xx or 5xx error response to the INVITE indicating the call failed for some reason

call_missed.title: Call missed
call_missed.description:
This event is triggered when an incoming call isn’t answered by any phone in your net2phone account.
The reason field indicates the reason the call was missed and can be `user_did_not_answer` if the Team Member didn’t answer, `user_rejected_call` if the Team Member actively rejected the call, or `user_not_logged_in` if calling another net2phone user who is not logged in

call_id.description: Describes a unique identifier for call

call_source.description: Can be either Normal or click2call. Normal describes a standard call via phone or web dialer, click2call describes a call initiated via the net2phone Click2Call API

user.description: The user object describes information about the user and account that triggered the event

id.description: A unqiue identifier assigned to each Team Member

name.description: The full display name of the Team member

account_id.description: This is your net2phone account ID

user_name.description: Is provided for backwards compatibility with previous versions of webhooks only. It’s strongly suggested that you avoid using this field.

emergency_call.title: Emergency call
emergency_call.description: This event is triggered when a call is placed to an emergency serivce

event.description: Describes the event that triggered the webhook notification

timestamp.description: Date and timestamp of the trigger event. Date and time are in ISO8601 UTC format

direction.description: Can be either inbound or outbound. Inbound describes an incoming call answered by any Team Member. Outbound describes an outgoing call made by any Team Member

originating_number.description: Describes the number that started the phone call

dialed_number.description: The recipient of the phone call

call_leg_id.description:
Describes a unique identifier for the leg of a call that has multiple legs.
For example, if a single call is answered, put on hold, and then transferred via consultative transfer to another Team Member, each leg of the call will have a unique call_leg_id, but  a common call_id

call_id.description: Describes a unique identifier for call

call_source.description: Can be either Normal or click2call. Normal describes a standard call via phone or web dialer, click2call describes a call initiated via the net2phone Click2Call API

user.description: The user object describes information about the user and account that triggered the event

id.description: A unqiue identifier assigned to each Team Member

name.description: The full display name of the Team member

account_id.description: This is your net2phone account ID

user_name.description: Is provided for backwards compatibility with previous versions of webhooks only. It’s strongly suggested that you avoid using this field.

message_received.title: Message Received
message_received.description: This event is triggered when a Team Member or Account receives a message

event.description: Describes the event that triggered the webhook notification

timestamp.description: Date and timestamp of the trigger event. Date and time are in ISO8601 UTC format

originated.description: Describes the number that send the message

terminated.description: Describes the number that recieved the message

user.description: The user object describes information about the user and account that triggered the event

id.description: A unqiue identifier assigned to each Team Member

name.description: The full display name of the Team member

account_id.description: This is your net2phone account ID

user_name.description: Is provided for backwards compatibility with previous versions of webhooks only. It’s strongly suggested that you avoid using this field.

voicemail_missed.title: Voicemail missed
voicemail_missed.description:
This event is triggered when an incoming call is sent to a Team Member’s voicemail but the caller doesn’t leave a voicemail. A common scenario for this would be the case where the callers hangs up before leaving a voicemail.
The reason field describes the reason for the caller didn’t leave a voicemail can can be either `caller_hungup` if the caller disconnected before recording a message or `vm_disabled` if the Team Member’s VM account was disabled at the time

dialed_number.description: The recipient of the phone call

id.description: A unqiue identifier assigned to each Team Member

name.description: The full display name of the Team member

account_id.description: This is your net2phone account ID

user_name.description: Is provided for backwards compatibility with previous versions of webhooks only. It’s strongly suggested that you avoid using this field.

duration.description: Length of time in seconds of the call or voicemail

click_to_call_info.description: Information about the click to call event. Present only when the `call_source = click2call`

c2c_api_request_id.description: Unique ID of the click2call api request

voicemail_notify.title: Voicemail notify
voicemail_notify.description:
This event is triggered when an incoming call is sent to a Team Member’s voicemail but the caller doesn’t leave a voicemail. A common scenario for this would be the case where the callers hangs up before leaving a voicemail.
The reason field describes the reason for the caller didn’t leave a voicemail can can be either `caller_hungup` if the caller disconnected before recording a message or `vm_disabled` if the Team Member’s VM account was disabled at the time

timestamp.description: Date and timestamp of the trigger event. Date and time are in ISO8601 UTC format

call_source.description: Can be either Normal or click2call. Normal describes a standard call via phone or web dialer, click2call describes a call initiated via the net2phone Click2Call API

account_id.description: This is your net2phone account ID

user_name.description: Is provided for backwards compatibility with previous versions of webhooks only. It’s strongly suggested that you avoid using this field.

voicemail_received.title: Voicemail received
voicemail_received.description: A voicemail was left for a net2phone user. This event will trigger when an incoming (only) call is not answered by any phone in your net2phone account and a voicemail is recorded.

event.description: Describes the event that triggered the webhook notification

timestamp.description: Date and timestamp of the trigger event. Date and time are in ISO8601 UTC format

direction.description: Can be either inbound or outbound. Inbound describes an incoming call answered by any Team Member. Outbound describes an outgoing call made by any Team Member

originating_number.description: Describes the number that started the phone call

dialed_number.description: The recipient of the phone call

call_leg_id.description:
Describes a unique identifier for the leg of a call that has multiple legs.
For example, if a single call is answered, put on hold, and then transferred via consultative transfer to another Team Member, each leg of the call will have a unique call_leg_id, but  a common call_id

call_id.description: Describes a unique identifier for call

call_source.description: Can be either Normal or click2call. Normal describes a standard call via phone or web dialer, click2call describes a call initiated via the net2phone Click2Call API

user.description: The user object describes information about the user and account that triggered the event

id.description: A unqiue identifier assigned to each Team Member

name.description: The full display name of the Team member

account_id.description: This is your net2phone account ID

user_name.description: Is provided for backwards compatibility with previous versions of webhooks only. It’s strongly suggested that you avoid using this field.

audio_message_id.description: ID of the audio message for a call recording or voicemail

audio_message_url.description: Url to access the audio message of a call recording or voicemail

duration.description: Length of time in seconds of the call or voicemail

call_answered.description: This event is triggered when a Team Member answers an incoming call or when an outgoing call is answered by the dialed destination number

call_blind_transfer.description: This event is issued when a Team Member transfers a call via  blind (cold) transfer

call_blocked.description:
This event is triggered when an incoming call is blocked.
If the number is blocked at the account level only the `user.account_id` field is present - see examples.

call_busy.description: The event is triggered when an outbound call receives a 4xx or 5xx error response to the INVITE indicating the call failed for some reason

call_completed.description: Event is triggered when a call is successfully completed. This event will trigger for both inbound and outbound calls.

call_consultative_transfer.description: This event is issued when a Team Member transfers a call via  consultative (warm) transfer

call_forward.description: This event is triggered when a Team Member forwards a call

call_hold.description: This event is triggered when a Team Member puts a call on hold

call_missed.description:
This event is triggered when an incoming call isn’t answered by any phone in your net2phone account.
The reason field indicates the reason the call was missed and can be `user_did_not_answer` if the Team Member didn’t answer, `user_rejected_call` if the Team Member actively rejected the call, or `user_not_logged_in` if calling another net2phone user who is not logged in

call_park.description: This event is triggered when a Team Member parks a call

call_pickup.description: This notification is triggered when a Team Member uses the Pick Up feature (*21) to answer a call ringing on another Team Members extension

call_recorded.description: This event is triggered when an inbound or outbound call has been successfully recorded.

call_recording_failed.description: This event is triggered when a call fails to record

call_resume.description: This event is triggered when a Team Member resumes a call

call_rg_queue_completed.description: The event is issued when a call in a RG completes by either being answered in a Tier or the caller hangs up.

call_rg_queue_entered.description: The event is issued when a call enters a RG with call queue enabled

call_rg_queue_tier.summary: Call ring group queue sent to tier
call_rg_queue_tier.description: The event is issued when a call waiting in a RG with call queue enabled enters a Tier which results in calls being sent to TM in that Tier.

call_ringing.description: This event is triggered when a call is ringing. This event will trigger for both inbound and outbound calls and is typically followed by by a `call_answered` or `call_missed` event

call_unpark.description: This event is triggered when a Team Member unparks a call. NOTE The team member that unparks a call will also get a call_answered event

emergency_call.description: This event is triggered when a call is placed to an emergency serivce

message_received.description: This event is triggered when a Team Member or Account receives a message

voicemail_missed.description:
This event is triggered when an incoming call is sent to a Team Member’s voicemail but the caller doesn’t leave a voicemail. A common scenario for this would be the case where the callers hangs up before leaving a voicemail.
The reason field describes the reason for the caller didn’t leave a voicemail can can be either `caller_hungup` if the caller disconnected before recording a message or `vm_disabled` if the Team Member’s VM account was disabled at the time

voicemail_notify.description:
This event is triggered when an incoming call is sent to a Team Member’s voicemail but the caller doesn’t leave a voicemail. A common scenario for this would be the case where the callers hangs up before leaving a voicemail.
The reason field describes the reason for the caller didn’t leave a voicemail can can be either `caller_hungup` if the caller disconnected before recording a message or `vm_disabled` if the Team Member’s VM account was disabled at the time

voicemail_received.description: A voicemail was left for a net2phone user. This event will trigger when an incoming (only) call is not answered by any phone in your net2phone account and a voicemail is recorded.
